etymology.interpretation: The hand element signals an action done with the hand. 涅 (niè) contributes the sound in shortened form, yielding the sense of pinching with the fingers.

examples.chinese: 他轻轻捏我的脸颊(他輕輕捏我的臉頰)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qīngqīng niē wǒ de liǎnjiá.

examples.chinese: 小孩把泥团捏成球(小孩把泥團捏成球)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎohái bǎ ní tuán niē chéng qiú.
examples.english: The child pinched the clay into a ball.

examples.chinese: 他把饺子皮捏紧(他把餃子皮捏緊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ jiǎozi pí niē jǐn.
examples.english: He pinched the dumpling wrapper closed.
